column4: Hi! I'm trying to install Ubuntu 8.04 on a laptop it gets to "Loading, please wait..." then it ends up on commandline ("ubuntu@ubuntu") - any ideas?
: did you install the boot loader?
blacking : try making your own themes and backgrounds. always an easy place to start
This is before the installation i started. I select the option to install Ubuntu and then after some loading it just stops and shows the commandline :(
: select the option run live cd
I tried that too, it freeze after "runing local bootscript [OK]" or something like that...
: what specs are your machine?
it's an Acer Aspire 1350
: what processor do you have?
mobile AMD Athlon XP 2400+
zorac : what install disk do you have? xi386?
yeah, x386
zorac : you need to download the version for AMD processors . . .
there is an separate version for AMD? *embarrased*
zorac : yeah their is because the kernal needs to be configured for the specific processor
I only see a version for 64 bit AMD?
zorac : is your computer not x64?
no, it's just a regular Amd Athlon XP
zorac : well the installation should definatly work . . . try re downloading the file and buring to a different disk.
the same CD works fine on a different machine...
zorac : i dont honesty know what the problem is so. . . try the forums maybe? sorry
ok... thanks anyway :) I'll try the forums then...
